SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
SERVICE CLOUD
Tips for Creating Macros

How you name and design your macro can impact its usefulness to support agents. Keep these tips in mind when creating macros.

The Macro Name helps support agents decide which macro to use.

Description is optional, but useful for helping support agents understand what the macro does.

The macro instructions are like a little computer program. Each instruction is equivalent to a click that the support agent makes when manually performing the task.

If a Salesforce Console for Service component isn’t enabled and configured, then you can’t create a macro for it.

You can add an extra set of instructions in the same context or in a different context.

If you use the International Components for Unicode (ICU) library instead of the Java Development Kit (JDK) library, review and manually update your Salesforce Classic macros that set the date, time, or currency.

Date and Time: Ensure that the date and time format is supported in the ICU library.
Currency: Ensure that the comma and decimal are valid for your currency.

Supported Date and Time Formats (ICU)
title: Creating Macros in Service Cloud
